Negative Reviews: Inability to honor special requests. Booked more than a month in advance and requested a lower bed due to recent knee surgery. Property responded that request could not be guaranteed. I phoned the property on arrival day to advise my train was arriving late and once again made the special request. Later that evening, the attendant knocked on my door to tell me that I would have to check out in the morning, bring my bags down to the storage office and check in again after 3pm. I agreed only because he promised that a lower bed was guaranteed on the property’s ground floor. The next morning I followed the given instructions and was re-assured of the stated arrangement, he even indicated that I was assigned to room #6.  I was told I did not need to re-check at exactly 3pm, that my assigned room and lower bed would be held until 2am. After a day of sightseeing and dinner, I arrived back at the property at 10pm only to be informed by the check in clerk that my room assignment was not room 6 and the bed was not a lower berth. I Immediately became livid and refused to accept this and demanded that my prior arrangement be honored. I was told that there were no more lower beds available. Very fortunate for me, the night attendant was also in the reception area and intervened. The night attendant had been present earlier that morning when I dropped off my bags for storage and heard when I was speaking to the manager about the inconveniences I was experiencing with changing rooms. He immediately found a solution by instructing the clerk to switch room assignments with other guests that had not yet checked in. I was finally assigned to a lower bed even though the room was on the third level of the property. However, the clerk was helpful in carrying my bag up the stairs to the room.

Review Title: Go somewhere else. Pay more for another hostel
Negative Reviews:
So, the free breakfast is from 8am to 10am, which starts quite late and means a lot of people are going to be waiting at 8am. The kitchen where breakfast is served is not especially spacious, so it'll be like sardines in a can. No space to eat. It is also very basic. It's basically the cheapest cereals, the cheapest bread, and the cheapest spread (except for jif peanut butter).

I stayed in a shared room, namely room 6. Since the walls are paper thin, despite being two walls away from the living room, and despite the hostel having a policy required guests to be quiet past 11pm, I could hear people shouting and playing music extremely loudly at 1am, and the staff that was about 5m away did not tell them to stay quiet. And then the very same at 8am, when someone was also blasting music for the whole hostel to hear. The beds do not really have power outlets, there is a multiplier right between the top and bottom beds, so on top of the plugs unplugging in the middle of the night because of how flimsy the multiplier is, bring cords that are at least 1.5m (~2 yards). Moreover, the bed themselves are extremely flimsy, so any minor movement in the top bunk and the whole bed is going to shake like crazy. 

Finally, and this I'm writing separate from the room because of how disgusting and unsanitary it is, my bathroom was filled to the brim with massively furry black mold. In the picture you can see the mold by the shower door and on the bathroom floor. Make what you will out of that

Honestly, all in all I would strongly recommend to go to any other hostel or hotel.
